intro: Donatophorus erythrospermus, commonly known as the red-seeded flax, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Linaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, followed by distinctive red, fleshy seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
